content: # Government of Ireland International Education Scholarships Program The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) program supports exceptional international students aiming to pursue master's or PhD studies in Ireland. Funded by the Government of Ireland in collaboration with Irish higher education institutions and managed by the Higher Education Authority, this initiative awards 60 scholarships annually for one year of full-time study at the master's or PhD level. A Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship includes a stipend of 10,000 euros for one year of full-time study at the master's or PhD level. Applicants of the Government of Ireland International Education Scholarships Programme must possess a valid offer letter while applying. There is no age limit prescribed to apply for the Government of Ireland International Education Scholarships Program.

content: Many international students are attracted to Ireland due to its high-quality universities, research opportunities, and diverse range of scholarships that help make studying abroad more affordable. This MSM Unify guide explores the various scholarships available in Ireland, including government-funded programs, university-specific scholarships, and popular options for international students. Many Irish universities offer scholarships specifically for international students. With a variety of government-funded, university-specific, and popular international scholarships, students have many ways to reduce the financial burden of studying abroad. Scholarships include the Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship, the Irish Aid Fellowship Program, and university-specific scholarships like those from Trinity College Dublin and University College Dublin. Yes, several universities, including Trinity College Dublin and University College Dublin, offer scholarships specifically for undergraduate international students.

content: This new Statement of Strategy will reflect and be informed by the Government commitments in the Programme for Government - Securing Ireland’s Future in addition to key Departmental policies and objectives including: • implementing Young Ireland, the Government’s national policy framework for children and young people, supporting them to achieve their potential • promoting the development of a progressive, respectful and equal society, including for persons with disabilities, in line with a rights-based approach and with a particular focus on intervention and proactive support by supporting the State’s response to the needs of survivors of institutional trauma • making high-quality early learning and care and school-age childcare, accessible • ensuring that parents are supported to parent confidently and positively • ensuring child welfare and protection systems are effective and responsive • promoting and supporting evidence-based policy and letting children and young people participate in decisions that affect their lives 27 While applicants may apply for one scholarship theme only, those who choose to apply for a strategic funding partner scholarship will also be considered for a Government of Ireland Postgraduate Scholarship.

scholarship_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
content: The **Government of Ireland International Education Scholarships (GOI-IES) 2025** could be your gateway to achieving academic excellence while experiencing the rich cultural heritage of Ireland. The **GOI-IES** is a highly competitive scholarship program designed to attract top-tier international students to Irish higher education institutions (HEIs). For the 2025/2026 academic year**,** the program plans to award **60 scholarships,** each valued at **€10,000,** to support one year of full-time, in-person study at the **master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD level.** In addition to the stipend, successful applicants will receive a **full tuition fee waiver** from their host institution. * Applicants who have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again. * Apply to your chosen institution(s) and obtain a **conditional or final offer of admission** before submitting your scholarship application.

Students holding a valid immigration stamp 2 permission will be permitted to work 40 hours per week only during the months of June, July, August and September and from 15 th December to 15 th January inclusive. This scheme exists to allow legally resident non-EU third level graduates to remain in Ireland in order to look for employment or apply for a green card/work permit. This allows non-EU/EEA students who have graduated from Irish higher education institutions to remain in Ireland for 24 months to seek employment.
